conversation.en_sentence: The more you have your presentation memorized, the easier it will be to make eye contact with people.

conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: 上手く行きますように！
conversation.en_sentence: Good luck!
You wanted to talk with me Mr. Ko?
conversation.ja_sentence: 高さん、お話があるとのことですが？

conversation.en_sentence: Um, thank you Mr. Ko.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、ありがとうございます、高さん。

conversation.en_sentence: May I ask who he is and what his relationship is with this company?
conversation.ja_sentence: この方が誰で、当社とどのような関係があるか教えていただけますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me?
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません。

conversation.en_sentence: But how am I even going to proceed?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、いったいどうやって進めればいいんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to know what type of product he is interested in or what brought his business card to our company in order to make the contact more relatable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡して話を進めるには、彼がどのような製品に興味があり、なぜ当社に名刺を置いて行ったか知る必要があるのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I think you misunderstood me.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみませんが、私のことを誤解されているようです。

conversation.en_sentence: I just don't want to be inefficient here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、ここで非効率なことはしたくないだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: I also don't want him to feel like this is a cold call.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、彼に飛び込み営業だと思われたくないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: But you just said you never met him!
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、会ったことはないと仰いましたよね！

conversation.en_sentence: But Mr. Ko!
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、高さん！

conversation.en_sentence: Is this how I am suppose to work?
conversation.ja_sentence: こういうのが仕事のやり方なんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean, if I just made a silly cold call, and babbled about Mr. Ko having his business card wondering how it got there, doesn't that reflect badly on this company?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、バカみたいな飛び込み営業の電話をして、出どころも分からないのに高さんが名刺を持っていたことを説明して、それってうちの会社の評判を落とさないんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: That is not what he said.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんなこと彼は言ってませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: All right, so I get some background info from John, and?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、では、ジョンさんから背景を聞いてみます、それから？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh please, it's not even funny.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、もちろん、冗談にもならなかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: He was so condescending, like we are in school and he is the headmaster or something.
conversation.ja_sentence: まるで私たちが生徒で彼が校長か何かのように、とっても上から目線で。

conversation.en_sentence: Welcome everyone, please be seated.
conversation.ja_sentence: みなさん、ようこそ、どうぞおかけください。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm Tracy with Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はA社のトレイシーです。

conversation.en_sentence: This is my colleagues Jim.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは私の同僚のジムです。

conversation.en_sentence: Today we're going to show you how your team can use product A to engage with prospective clients as well as your current customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は御社のチームが既存顧客と同じように見込み顧客と関わっていかれるために、製品Aをどのように使用していただいたら良いかについて話をさせていただきたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Product A is fully customizable, so it depends on which setup you choose.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Aは全てがカスタマイズ可能な商品で、どのような設定を選ばれるかによって価格は変わってきます。

conversation.en_sentence: We certainly understand that price is a very important question.
conversation.ja_sentence: 価格が大変重要な問題であることは確かに理解しておりますので。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to give you the wrong price, so we'll look at a few options later in the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 間違った価格を申し上げるわけにはいきませんので、会議の後半でいくつかの選択肢を見ていきたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Jim, can you tell them about organizing accounts?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジム、アカウントの整理について話してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: The first thing I do is login to Product A and check my home page.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が最初にすることは製品Aにログインして私のホームページをチェックすることです。

conversation.en_sentence: At the top of the page are my tabs which quickly help me find all of the information I need.
conversation.ja_sentence: ページの一番上には私のタブがあり、私が必要な全ての情報をすぐに見つけるのに役立ちます。

conversation.en_sentence: Then I write my status update.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから私はステータスを更新します。

conversation.en_sentence: To let my colleagues know what I'm working on now, and collaborate with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同僚に現在自分が取り組んでいることを知らせ、協力し合うためです。

conversation.en_sentence: “My dashboard” is where I track the business data that is most important to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 「マイ・ダッシュボード」は、みなさまにとって最も重要なビジネスデータを追跡する場所です。

conversation.en_sentence: You can follow the business information that matters the most to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: みなさまのそれぞれの業務に1番関係するビジネス情報をフォローしていただくことが出来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: What sort of business data do you use the most often?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなビジネスデータを1番頻繁に使用なさりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely, you can see all of your team's deals.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、出来ます、チームの取引を全部見ていただくことが可能です。

conversation.en_sentence: You can even set permissions to let them see each others deals.
conversation.ja_sentence: お互いの取引が見れるように権限を設定していただくこともできます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Mr. Williams.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィリアムズさん、こんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: I brought you in to talk about your performance over the past two months.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去２ヶ月の成績について話したくて来てもらいました。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, it seems like you've been underperforming compared to your coworkers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、他のチームメンバー達と比較してウィリアムズさんの業績が低調です。

conversation.en_sentence: Is everything OK with you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはお気の毒に。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope your father is recovering.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良くなるのを願っています。

conversation.en_sentence: It would be OK if you need to take some time off to be with your family.
conversation.ja_sentence: 家族と過ごすために休みを取りたいのであれば可能ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sympathetic to family concerns.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は家族のことに関して同情しています。

conversation.en_sentence: However, I need you to come back ready to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、戻ってくるときには仕事が出来るように準備していただきたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have have many important deadlines next month, and I will need you to be focused on work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月たくさんの締め切りがあって、集中して取り組んでいただきたいので。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was going to suggest you to take one week off.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一週間休みを取るよう提案する所でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Please spend the time with your family and don’t think about work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事のことは考えず、家族との時間を過ごしてください。

conversation.en_sentence: However I will need you to be ready to work hard when you return.
conversation.ja_sentence: 戻ってきたときには一生懸命働いてくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem Mr. Williams.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないですよ、ウィリアムズさん。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, again, I hope your father makes a fast recovery.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、繰り返すようだけど、お父さんが早く治るのを願っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうして下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I was looking at your website just now.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、たった今そちらのウェブサイトを見てたんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I really want your lady bug costume but I'm a little bit confused about the size.
conversation.ja_sentence: テントウムシのコスチュームがとても欲しいんですが、サイズについてちょっと困惑してまして。

conversation.en_sentence: It's the one that comes with all the accessories.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全てのアクセサリーが付いてる方です。

conversation.en_sentence: Yep, that's it.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was checking the reviews from other people.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人のレビューをチェックしてたんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Some people said it was too small and others said it was too big.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何人かの人は小さすぎるって書いてたんですが、他の人は大きすぎるって。

conversation.en_sentence: So I just wanted to double check before I order it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから注文する前にちょっとダブルチェックしたかったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに。

conversation.en_sentence: She's six.
conversation.ja_sentence: 6歳です。

conversation.en_sentence: I think she is quite skinny for her age though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 年齢にしてはかなり痩せてる方だと思うんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Will that work, you think?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで大丈夫だと思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hmmm, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、そうね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm glad I checked with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたに確認してよかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I'd better order it soon then.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、じゃ早く注文したほうがいいわね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for your advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Nope, I'm good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Have a great week.
conversation.ja_sentence: よい一週間を。
高田さん、ちょっと相談していいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Takada-san, can I ask your opinion about something?

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の株主総会準備ミーティングで、総会時の手土産を選定したいんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: At next week's meeting about the preparations for the shareholders' general meeting, I'd like to select the gift that we will give out in the general meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 手土産の候補をいくつか出しておこうかと思っているんですけど、いい案あります？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm thinking of presenting several potential gifts, but do you have any good ideas?

conversation.ja_sentence: 出席株主一人当たり１０００円位が妥当かなと思ってます。
conversation.en_sentence: I think about 1,000 yen per attending shareholder should be about right.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、去年は１２２名参加でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, 122 people attended last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年は２００セット用意して、一人あたり１０４０円でした。
conversation.en_sentence: We prepared 200 gift sets last year, at a price of 1,040 yen per person.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お菓子は会社のロゴをプリントした饅頭でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the confections were steamed buns that had the company logo printed on them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 悪くはなかったんですけど、賞味期限が短かったのがネックかなと。
conversation.en_sentence: Not badly at all, the only issue was that they had a short expiration date.

conversation.ja_sentence: 余った分は社内で配ったのですが、来年もまた、っていう雰囲気じゃなかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: We shared the leftover buns amongst people in the company, but there wasn't a general feeling that we would do them again the next year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんは何がいいと思いますか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you think would be good?

conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、抽象的ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's pretty abstract.

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的に思い付きませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you not think of anything specific?

conversation.ja_sentence: 何でです？
conversation.en_sentence: Why?

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんがそんな験担ぎするのは意外ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't think you were so superstitious.

conversation.ja_sentence: 切ないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds tragic.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんな話を聞いてしまったら、私も鳩の形したお菓子にしたくなってきましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: After hearing your story, I've also come round to the idea of dove-shaped confectionery.

conversation.ja_sentence: 候補の一つとしてあげてみます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will present it as one of the potential choices.
